MC.content: not that all fiction, all inscription of proper names has literary dimension, but they arise in a place where limits are never real, never immobile, never solid—only the effects of contextual isolation > pragrammatological (intersection of pragmatics & grammatology)
MC.linkedContent: not that all fiction, all inscription of proper names has literary dimension, but they arise in a place where limits are never real, never immobile, never solid—only the effects of contextual isolation > pragrammatological (intersection of pragmatics & grammatology)

POS.content: Derrida never attempted to oppose graphocentrism to logocentrism, OG not a mystification of writing’s value; OG proposes question/limits of science of writing
POS.linkedContent: Derrida never attempted to oppose graphocentrism to logocentrism, OG not a mystification of writing’s value; OG proposes question/limits of science of writing

POS.content: grammatology must liberate mathematization of language (which phonocentrism has always critiqued, for limiting that which links logos to phonē), but must be wary of Leibniz’s type of unifying, simple, mathematical language, which appeals to divine logos
POS.linkedContent: grammatology must liberate mathematization of language (which phonocentrism has always critiqued, for limiting that which links logos to phonē), but must be wary of Leibniz’s type of unifying, simple, mathematical language, which appeals to divine logos

POS.content: grammatology must ceaselessly deconstruct everything that ties concepts/norms of scientificity to ontotheology, phono-logocentrism, must transgress w/out falling back into prescientific empiricism, it must affirm wherever science exceeds logocentric closure > grammatology inscribes and delimits science, marks/loosens limit closing classical scientificity
POS.linkedContent: grammatology must ceaselessly deconstruct everything that ties concepts/norms of scientificity to ontotheology, phono-logocentrism, must transgress w/out falling back into prescientific empiricism, it must affirm wherever science exceeds logocentric closure > grammatology inscribes and delimits science, marks/loosens limit closing classical scientificity

POS.content: grammatology vigilant practice of textual division (i.e. metaphysical presuppositions occurring w/ critical motifs, i.e. Hjelmslev’s glossematics)
POS.linkedContent: grammatology vigilant practice of textual division (i.e. metaphysical presuppositions occurring w/ critical motifs, i.e. Hjelmslev’s glossematics)

ROP.content: OG about the impossibility of the science of grammatology
ROP.linkedContent: OG about the impossibility of the science of grammatology

OG.content: science of grammatology, of writing, though necessary, may never be established, never voir le jour [because of the phono-logocentric metaphysics determining it]
OG.linkedContent: science of grammatology, of writing, though necessary, may never be established, never voir le jour [because of the phono-logocentric metaphysics determining it]

OG.content: natural writing (breath) pneumatological not grammatological
OG.linkedContent: natural writing (breath) pneumatological not grammatological

OG.content: interior holy voice of faith; natural law, native unity of voice & writing is prescriptive, commandment > good writing comprehended as that which had to be comprehended
OG.linkedContent: interior holy voice of faith; natural law, native unity of voice & writing is prescriptive, commandment > good writing comprehended as that which had to be comprehended

OG.content: the science of writing born in period of world’s history, look for roots of scientificity, roots of historicity, thus science of possibility of science, history of history, a grammatics not logic?
OG.linkedContent: the science of writing born in period of world’s history, look for roots of scientificity, roots of historicity, thus science of possibility of science, history of history, a grammatics not logic?

OG.content: “the origin of writing?”: [how does this question disrupt grammatology?]
OG.linkedContent: “the origin of writing?”: [how does this question disrupt grammatology?]

OG.content: linguistics aspires to be science of language
OG.linkedContent: linguistics aspires to be science of language

OG.content: the tension btwn autre geste [written w/out being uttered (proféré)] and propos déclaré > where grammatology has a future beyond linguistics-phonology [re: Saussure]
OG.linkedContent: the tension btwn autre geste [written w/out being uttered (proféré)] and propos déclaré > where grammatology has a future beyond linguistics-phonology [re: Saussure]

OG.content: Martinet suggests replacing unity [bias] of word w/ “syntagm” (nothing to do w/ meaning), “group of several minimal signs” or “monemes”
OG.linkedContent: Martinet suggests replacing unity [bias] of word w/ “syntagm” (nothing to do w/ meaning), “group of several minimal signs” or “monemes”

OG.content: Sausurre’s 2 systems of writing: ideographic, phonetic
OG.linkedContent: Sausurre’s 2 systems of writing: ideographic, phonetic

OG.content: if writing is mere “figuration” of language—it is exiled, cast outside, a double > unrelated to interior of the system: “internal system” is an epistemological exigency constituted by possibility of phonetic writing
OG.linkedContent: if writing is mere “figuration” of language—it is exiled, cast outside, a double > unrelated to interior of the system: “internal system” is an epistemological exigency constituted by possibility of phonetic writing

OG.content: but this science [deconstructive grammatology?], where opening of “image” conditions “reality,” can’t maintain classical scientific grid: external/internal, image/reality, representation/presence > this science inaugurates the originality of its field
OG.linkedContent: but this science [deconstructive grammatology?], where opening of “image” conditions “reality,” can’t maintain classical scientific grid: external/internal, image/reality, representation/presence > this science inaugurates the originality of its field

OG.content: Saussure opens field of grammatology when he’s not talking about writing: so that what was chased off, proscribed to outside, never ceased to haunt language
OG.linkedContent: Saussure opens field of grammatology when he’s not talking about writing: so that what was chased off, proscribed to outside, never ceased to haunt language

OG.content: for Hegel & Saussure, “symbols”: the only natural signs, only signs that escape semiology as grammatology
OG.linkedContent: for Hegel & Saussure, “symbols”: the only natural signs, only signs that escape semiology as grammatology

OG.content: (70, 74) substitute grammatology for semiology, le devenir-immotivé du symbole [via Pierce]: no more pertinence of synchronic/diachronic, and semiology no longer mastered by exemplary linguistic sign (master-sign)
OG.linkedContent: (70, 74) substitute grammatology for semiology, le devenir-immotivé du symbole [via Pierce]: no more pertinence of synchronic/diachronic, and semiology no longer mastered by exemplary linguistic sign (master-sign)

OG.content: arche-writing can never be an object of science, it is that which cannot be reduced to a form of presence
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing can never be an object of science, it is that which cannot be reduced to a form of presence

OG.content: Derrida uses word writing in relation to the vulgar concept of writing, which, historically, would have been impossible w/out dissimulation of arche-writing (desire of speech displacing its other)
OG.linkedContent: Derrida uses word writing in relation to the vulgar concept of writing, which, historically, would have been impossible w/out dissimulation of arche-writing (desire of speech displacing its other)

OG.content: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language

OG.content: arche-writing cannot be an object in a linguistic system or the “immanent” system itself [glossematics] > but, doesn’t have a real field elsewhere
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing cannot be an object in a linguistic system or the “immanent” system itself [glossematics] > but, doesn’t have a real field elsewhere

OG.content: differance does not exist, the never being-present outside plenitude > no science of this nonorigin
OG.linkedContent: differance does not exist, the never being-present outside plenitude > no science of this nonorigin

OG.content: grammatology’s condition of possibility, the solicitation of logocentrism, is condition of impossibility, risks destroying concept of science, exorbitant aim (visée) beyond savoir
OG.linkedContent: grammatology’s condition of possibility, the solicitation of logocentrism, is condition of impossibility, risks destroying concept of science, exorbitant aim (visée) beyond savoir

OG.content: trace is nothing, exceeds question “what is?” > no longer sheltered in grammatological knowledge: no longer assurance of opposition fait/droit > no pure fait
OG.linkedContent: trace is nothing, exceeds question “what is?” > no longer sheltered in grammatological knowledge: no longer assurance of opposition fait/droit > no pure fait

OG.content: writing can’t be contained w/in a science—can’t have that ambition or modesty
OG.linkedContent: writing can’t be contained w/in a science—can’t have that ambition or modesty
